physical_appearance:This is a pair of painted ivory figures. The figures are presented in identical wooden framed boxes. On the left is Saint Joseph
 holding the Christ Child in his arms. On the right is Virgin Mary as Our Lady of Mount Carmel. Both figures are wearing long garments with minute detailings and gold trimmings. They are standing on a gold-and green platform within the frames.

sgcool_label_text:This pair of painted ivory figures depict Saint Joseph holding the Christ Child
 and the Virgin Mary as Our Lady of Mount Carmel. The heads
 hands
 and feet are made of ivory
 but the bodies hidden under the clothing are made of wood. The hair and eyelashes are probably human hair. \r\nImages such as these were admired and made in Spain
 as well as in the Asian territories under its influence. These were perhaps made for private devotion in the home

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a pair of painted ivory figures. The figures are presented in identical wooden framed boxes. On the left is Saint Joseph, holding the Christ Child in his arms. On the right is Virgin Mary as Our Lady of Mount Carmel. Both figures are wearing long garments with minute detailings and gold trimmings. They are standing on a gold-and green platform within the frames.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Figurines Worship Jesus Christ Mount Carmel, Our Lady of Mary, Mother Joseph, Saint Devotional objects
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This pair of painted ivory figures depict Saint Joseph holding the Christ Child, and the Virgin Mary as Our Lady of Mount Carmel. The heads, hands, and feet are made of ivory, but the bodies hidden under the clothing are made of wood. The hair and eyelashes are probably human hair. 
Images such as these were admired and made in Spain, as well as in the Asian territories under its influence. These were perhaps made for private devotion in the home
